üìã Overall Assessment

The agent successfully engaged the customer with a positive tone and humor, effectively addressing the pet's fussiness and providing a tailored solution. However, there were minor issues with information sequencing and clarity on the subscription model.

üí™ Top 3 Strengths

  1. ‚úÖ Positive and engaging tone throughout the call.
  2. ‚úÖ Effective use of pet's name to build rapport.
  3. ‚úÖ Addressed the pet's fussiness with appropriate solutions.

üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

  1. üî¥ Ensure clear distinction between taster and ongoing subscription prices.
  2. üî¥ Avoid information dumping after payment.
  3. üî¥ Provide more visual anchors during the pitch.

Detailed Section Breakdown

üåê

Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

4‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 8.5/10 ‚ñº

The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name frequently, creating a warm and engaging atmosphere.

ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) Nala Pet name used multiple times throughout the call.
‚úÖ 1.2 Tone & Sentiment (The 'Smile' Test) Hi there, it's Adam from Button or Box, the dog food company. Agent maintained a positive and enthusiastic tone.
‚úÖ 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) Don't leave the straighteners in. I don't want you to burn your hair out. Agent used humor and rapport to lift the call's energy.
‚úÖ 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule No monologues over 45 seconds without check-in.

üí™ Strengths

  • üí™ Frequent use of pet's name.
  • üí™ Positive and engaging tone.
  • üí™ Effective energy leadership.

    Introduction (The Trifecta)

    2‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 9.0/10 ‚ñº

    The agent introduced themselves and the brand effectively, using the pet's name and framing the discount as a win.

    ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes

So it's freshly cooked meat mixed with nutritious fruit and veggies. There's 11 recipes, so Nala can choose a favorite, so she's not going to be a fuzzpot anymore.         Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

        ‚úÖ 7.3 Reframing (The Investment) So we do have natural prebiotics in all the recipes. Reframed as investment in health.

        Human Element

        üìã Overall Assessment

        The agent maintained a positive tone and provided detailed information about the service. However, the call lacked depth in discovery and failed to personalize the pitch effectively to the customer's specific needs.

        üí™ Top 3 Strengths

        1. ‚úÖ Positive tone and enthusiasm throughout the call.
        2. ‚úÖ Clear explanation of subscription and referral benefits.
        3. ‚úÖ Mentioned the veterinary support available.

        üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

        1. üî¥ Use the pet's name more frequently to build emotional connection.
        2. üî¥ Engage in deeper discovery to identify specific customer needs.
        3. üî¥ Avoid long monologues without customer interaction.

        Detailed Section Breakdown

        üåê

        Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

        2‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

        The agent maintained a positive tone but did not use the pet's name frequently enough and had a long monologue.

        ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes

        ‚úÖ 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) Well, I hope Stanley enjoys everything. Agent kept the energy up throughout the call.
        ‚ùå 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule So yeah, Caroline, obviously I noticed everything has gone through on our side... Agent had a monologue longer than 45 seconds.

        üí™ Strengths

        • üí™ Maintained positive tone and energy.

        üìà Improvements

        üéß Agent 02:47 All right, perfect. Well, I hope Stanley enjoys everything. But yeah, that's all from me from my side. If you did have any questions, just give us a call and we can get that all sorted out for you then.
        üë§ Customer 02:56 Okay, lovely. Thank you very much.
        üéß Agent 02:58 Thank you, Caroline. Bye.
        üé¨

        Introduction (The Trifecta)

        2‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 6.0/10 ‚ñº

        The agent introduced themselves and the brand effectively but did not use the pet's name immediately.

        ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
        ‚úÖ 2.1 Identity & Brand Anchor Hello. Hi Caroline, it's Amrita again. Agent stated their name and greeted the customer.
        ‚úÖ 2.2 Structure & Authority So yeah, Caroline, obviously I noticed everything has gone through on our side... Agent referenced the setup and structure of the service.

        üí™ Strengths

        • üí™ Clear introduction of self and brand.

        üìà Improvements

        • üìà Use the pet's name immediately in the opener.
        üéß Agent 00:00 Hello. Hi Caroline, it's Amrita again.
        üë§ Customer 00:03 Hiya. Hi, how are you?
        üéß Agent 00:05 I'm okay, thank you. Yeah, perfect. So yeah, Caroline, obviously I noticed everything has gone through on our side, and I saw that beautiful picture of Stanley. You all had it on there. So yeah, just had to, obviously, as I said before, I just had to go over a couple of things with you. Nothing, you know, major, but it's just, you know, we have to go through a couple of paragraphs once everything's been set up. So as you can see, you have two weeks' worth of fresh food on its way to you. And on the 20th, I think we had it for the 29th of May. And the first box is where you should try out all the recipes, see which ones your dogs love. And the second box is where you will start noticing the nutritional impact of moving on to a fresh diet. That's why we've given you two discounted boxes. Try out your second box and see, you know, where you want to go from there. We are subscription-based service, Caroline, with no lock-in contract. So if you did require to pause the contract at any time or the subscription at any time, you could. But what we will do is send you natural fresh food every two weeks. Before we take out any payment, we will send you a reminder email just to make sure that everything is good on your side. On the app as well, you should see a section where it says free food. That's our friend control system, so you can send, you can get, if you send the code to your friends, you can give them 60% off their first box and 30% off their second box. And I think on the app it says you receive 65% off as well. So it is unlimited. If you send it to 100 people, that's 100 boxes for 65% off. A lot of people just like to bob it into a Facebook group chat with people who have dogs and they just get off their order and go from there. It's a great win-win situation for you. And last thing, we do have an in-house veterinary nursing team and a 24-hour help plan for our customers. So if you did have any, if you were looking for any advice on your pets, just give us a call. It's, you know, it doesn't have to do about dog food. It is just a service we do. I know how much vets can charge for just, you know, a quick five-minute consultation. So yeah, if you did need any advice on anything, then just feel free to give us a call. Everything will be in the welcome pack as well. So you'll have everything there in terms of what the numbers are, everything like that, a little transitional period as well. So how to get off from the diet that you're currently using and wean them onto a butternut box. Everything should be on there for you. Do you have any questions for me, Caroline?
        üë§ Customer 02:42 No, no, not at all. Nothing at the moment.
        üîé

        Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

        0‚úÖ 3‚ùå Fail 3.0/10 ‚ñº

        The agent did not engage in sufficient discovery to understand the customer's specific needs or preferences.

        ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
        ‚ùå 3.1 Brand Knowledge Check Agent did not gauge what the customer already knows about the brand.
        ‚ùå 3.2 The 'Discovery Loop' (Logic Gate) Agent did not probe deeper into customer's current brand or diet.
        ‚ùå 3.3 Nugget Extraction No specific 'Why' was identified during the call.

        üí™ Strengths

          üìà Improvements

          • üìà Engage in deeper discovery to identify customer needs.
          • üìà Ask about the customer's current brand or diet.
          üéß Agent 00:00 Hello. Hi Caroline, it's Amrita again.
          üë§ Customer 00:03 Hiya. Hi, how are you?
          üéß Agent 00:05 I'm okay, thank you. Yeah, perfect. So yeah, Caroline, obviously I noticed everything has gone through on our side, and I saw that beautiful picture of Stanley.                 0‚úÖ 4‚ùå Fail 3.0/10 ‚ñº

                ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                ‚ùå 7.1 The Journey Sequence [HARD FAIL] Did not cover the taster hook, ongoing cost, or daily cost anchor.
                ‚ùå 7.2 Value Comparison Did not compare the cost to the customer's current brand spend.
                ‚ùå 7.3 Reframing (The Investment) Did not reframe the cost as a long-term investment.
                ‚ùå 7.4 The 'Zip It' No silence after price reveal as price was not discussed.

                üí™ Strengths

                  üìà Improvements

                  • üìà Discuss the pricing structure clearly.
                  • üìà Reframe the cost as a long-term investment.

                  ‚ùå 8.2 The 'To-Do' List No 'homework' was assigned to the customer.
                  ‚ùå 8.3 Handling 'No' (The Wrangle) No objections were handled as the customer did not express any.

                  Negative Markers (Red Flags)

                  6‚úÖ 2‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                  The agent avoided major negative markers but had a long monologue and did not personalize the pitch.

                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                  ‚úÖ 9.1 Rushing Agent did not rush the customer.
                  ‚úÖ 9.2 Giving Up Agent did not give up on the sale.
                  ‚ùå 9.3 Lack of Personalization Did not use the pet's name during the pitch.
                  ‚úÖ 9.4 Price Too Early Price was not mentioned too early.
                  ‚ùå 9.5 Transactional Pushing Pitched without identifying a specific need.
                  ‚úÖ 9.6 Post-Payment Info Dumping No post-payment info dumping occurred.
                  ‚úÖ 9.7 The Logic Leap Did not ask for payment prematurely.
                  ‚úÖ 9.8 Rude/Abrasive Agent maintained a polite tone.

                  üí™ Strengths

                  • üí™ Avoided rushing the customer.
                  • üí™ Maintained a polite tone.

                  üìà Improvements

                  • üìà Personalize the pitch using the pet's name.
                  • üìà Identify specific customer needs before pitching.
                  üéß Agent 00:00 Hello. Hi Caroline, it's Amrita again.
                  üë§ Customer 00:03 Hiya. Hi, how are you?
                  üéß Agent 00:05 I'm okay, thank you. Yeah, perfect. So yeah, Caroline, obviously I noticed everything has gone through on our side, and I saw that beautiful picture of Stanley. You all had it on there. So yeah, just had to, obviously, as I said before, I just had to go over a couple of things with you. Nothing, you know, major, but it's just, you know, we have to go through a couple of paragraphs once everything's been set up. So as you can see, you have two weeks' worth of fresh food on its way to you. And on the 20th, I think we had it for the 29th of May. And the first box is where you should try out all the recipes, see which ones your dogs love. And the second box is where you will start noticing the nutritional impact of moving on to a fresh diet. That's why we've given you two discounted boxes. Try out your second box and see, you know, where you want to go from there. We are subscription-based service, Caroline, with no lock-in contract. So if you did require to pause the contract at any time or the subscription at any time, you could. But what we will do is send you natural fresh food every two weeks. Before we take out any payment, we will send you a reminder email just to make sure that everything is good on your side. On the app as well, you should see a section where it says free food. That's our friend control system, so you can send, you can get, if you send the code to your friends, you can give them 60% off their first box and 30% off their second box. And I think on the app it says you receive 65% off as well. So it is unlimited. If you send it to 100 people, that's 100 boxes for 65% off. A lot of people just like to bob it into a Facebook group chat with people who have dogs and they just get off their order and go from there. It's a great win-win situation for you. And last thing, we do have an in-house veterinary nursing team and a 24-hour help plan for our customers. So if you did have any, if you were looking for any advice on your pets, just give us a call. It's, you know, it doesn't have to do about dog food. It is just a service we do. I know how much vets can charge for just, you know, a quick five-minute consultation. So yeah, if you did need any advice on anything, then just feel free to give us a call. Everything will be in the welcome pack as well. So you'll have everything there in terms of what the numbers are, everything like that, a little transitional period as well. So how to get off from the diet that you're currently using and wean them onto a butternut box. Everything should be on there for you. Do you have any questions for me, Caroline?
                  üë§ Customer 02:42 No, no, not at all. Nothing at the moment.
                  üéß Agent 02:47 All right, perfect. Well, I hope Stanley enjoys everything. But yeah, that's all from me from my side. If you did have any questions, just give us a call and we can get that all sorted out for you then.
                  üë§ Customer 02:56 Okay, lovely. Thank you very much.
                  üéß Agent 02:58 Thank you, Caroline. Bye.

                  üìã Overall Assessment

                  The agent maintained a friendly tone and attempted to engage with the customer about Isla's dietary needs. However, the call lacked depth in discovery and failed to effectively connect the product benefits to the customer's specific concerns.

                  üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                  1. ‚úÖ Friendly and warm tone throughout the call.
                  2. ‚úÖ Acknowledged customer's feedback about the product.
                  3. ‚úÖ Mentioned a discount offer for future consideration.

                  üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                  1. üî¥ Failed to use Isla's name frequently enough throughout the call.
                  2. üî¥ Did not effectively probe into the customer's current diet plan.
                  3. üî¥ Missed opportunity to connect product benefits to specific customer concerns.

                        üë§ Customer 03:24

                        Brand
                        Both
                        Pet Name
                        Chester
                        Breed
                        Domestic Short Hair
                        Outcome
                        Sale
                        Clear USP
                        üçΩÔ∏è Fussy Eater
                        Overall Score
                        6.7/10
                        B

                        üìã Overall Assessment

                        The agent successfully engaged the customer with a friendly tone and addressed the primary concern of fussy eating. However, there were missed opportunities in linking the product features to specific customer needs and some information was delivered post-payment.

                        üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                        1. ‚úÖ Friendly and engaging tone
                        2. ‚úÖ Clear explanation of trial and subscription terms
                        3. ‚úÖ Effective use of pet name to build rapport

                        üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                        1. üî¥ Better link product features to specific pet needs
                        2. üî¥ Avoid information dumping post-payment
                        3. üî¥ Provide more visual comparisons for product size and storage

                        Detailed Section Breakdown

                        üåê

                        Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                        3‚úÖ 1‚ùå Pass 7.5/10 ‚ñº

                        The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name effectively, but there was a slight lapse in energy leadership.

                        ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                        ‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) Chester Pet name used multiple times throughout the call.
                        ‚úÖ 1.2 Tone & Sentiment (The 'Smile' Test) Hi Sarah, it's Ennis, just giving you a call from Mavo, the cat food company. Oh, hiya. Agent maintained a warm and friendly tone.
                        ‚ùå 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) Oh my God. Have you tried Button Up before? For the dogs? Agent matched customer's energy rather than lifting it.
                        ‚úÖ 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule So, it's all fresh. So, it comes frozen, but you leave it straight in the fridge. No monologue exceeded 45 seconds without a check-in.

                        üí™ Strengths

                        • üí™ Consistent use of pet's name
                        • üí™ Warm and engaging tone

                        üìà Improvements

                        • üìà Increase energy to lift customer engagement

                          ‚ùå 8.4 Subscription Value Your first week is a trial box. Did not provide a long-term reason to continue.

                          üìã Overall Assessment

                          The agent demonstrated a good understanding of the product and maintained a positive tone throughout the call. However, there were several missed opportunities to connect the product features to the specific needs of the pet, and the call ended without a successful sale due to technical issues.

                          üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                          1. ‚úÖ Positive tone and sentiment throughout the call.
                          2. ‚úÖ Effective use of the pet's name to build rapport.
                          3. ‚úÖ Clear explanation of the trial offer and discount.

                          üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                          1. üî¥ Better connection between product features and the pet's specific needs.
                          2. üî¥ Ensure technical issues are resolved promptly to avoid losing sales.
                          3. üî¥ Provide more detailed information about ongoing subscription costs.

                          Detailed Section Breakdown

                          üåê

                          Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                          3‚úÖ 1‚ùå Partial 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                          The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name frequently, but there was a missed opportunity to lift the customer's energy.

                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                          ‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) little Tilly Tilly Pet name used multiple times in the call.
                          ‚úÖ 1.2 Tone & Sentiment (The "Smile" Test) Oh great, and is your friend happy with our service? Agent maintained a positive and warm tone.
                          ‚ùå 1.3 Energy Leadership (The "Lift" Test) Oh wonderful, wonderful. Agent did not significantly lift the customer's energy.
                          ‚úÖ 1.4 The 45-Second "Robot" Rule So what we'll do, Victoria, is we'll open an account for little Tilly... No monologue exceeded 45 seconds without a check-in.

                            The Fix (Problem-Solution Matching)

                            1‚úÖ 1‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                            The agent mentioned some product features but did not effectively match them to the pet's specific needs.

                            ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                            ‚ùå 4.1 Breed-Specific Proactivity A Labrador. So what are you currently feeding her? No breed-specific issues suggested.
                            ‚úÖ 4.2 Need-Solution Match our food is actually human-grade food Mentioned high-quality food but did not link to specific needs.

                            üí™ Strengths

                            • üí™ Mentioned high-quality food.

                            üìà Improvements

                            • üìà Suggest breed-specific issues.
                            • üìà Link product features to specific needs.
                            üéß Agent 02:21 And has she been spayed?

                              The agent effectively engaged the customer with a positive tone and energy, successfully leading to a sale. However, there were areas for improvement in linking product features to specific pet needs and ensuring clarity in subscription details.

                              2. ‚úÖ Successfully closed the sale with clear instructions for the customer.
                              3. ‚úÖ Used the pet's name frequently to build rapport.

                              1. üî¥ Better link product features to specific pet needs discussed.
                              2. üî¥ Ensure clarity in explaining the subscription model and ongoing costs.

                                Introduction (The Trifecta)

                                2‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 8.0/10 ‚ñº

                                The agent introduced themselves and the brand promptly, using the pet's name to establish rapport.

                                ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                ‚úÖ 2.1 Identity & Brand Anchor It's Luke from Marrow, the cat food company. Agent introduced themselves and the brand within the first 10 seconds.
                                ‚úÖ 2.2 Structure & Authority It's some great news. You ended up getting yourself a massive discount here with us. Agent used hero language and framed the discount as a win.

                                üí™ Strengths

                                • üí™ Prompt introduction of self and brand.
                                • üí™ Effective use of hero language to frame the offer.

                                üìà Improvements

                                  Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

                                  2‚úÖ 1‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                                  The agent effectively gathered information about the pet and current feeding habits, but could have probed deeper into specific needs.

                                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                  ‚úÖ 3.1 Brand Knowledge Check Have you used us before? Heard of us before? No, first time. Agent checked customer's familiarity with the brand.
                                  ‚ùå 3.2 The "Discovery Loop" (Logic Gate) What do you feed him at the moment? I feed him the Amazon pate food. Agent did not probe deeper into why the customer chose the current brand.
                                  ‚úÖ 3.3 Nugget Extraction A lot of these different cat foods, a lot of them only have like 5% meat in the food. I've tried a few other brands, but the smell does me in. Identified a specific concern about the smell of other brands.

                                  The Fix (Problem-Solution Matching)

                                  1‚úÖ 1‚ùå Partial 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                  The agent mentioned the benefits of the product but did not fully connect them to the specific needs of the pet.

                                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                  ‚ùå 4.1 Breed-Specific Proactivity What breed are they? Just a regular breed, domestic, short hair. Agent did not suggest common breed issues.
                                  ‚úÖ 4.2 Need-Solution Match You'll notice like less smellier poos, like a shinier coat, better energy levels as well. Agent mentioned benefits but did not fully connect them to specific needs.

                                  üí™ Strengths

                                  • üí™ Mentioned benefits of the product.

                                  üìà Improvements

                                  • üìà Connect product benefits to specific pet needs discussed.

                                  üéß Agent 12:40 So that'll be ¬£31 for the month. We are a subscription-based service. There is no contract. There is no commitment. It'll show you exactly how to introduce our food in a way that works for your cat's system habits. It's kind of not just nice to have. It's what helps turn the fussier cats into foodies. We really recommend you kind of stick to that step-by-step, and then you'll really notice the benefits of our food moving forward.

                                  üéß Agent 14:14 It's already sorted there for you. Everything's already set up.

                                  Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

                                  ‚ùå 7.3 Reframing (The Investment) Agent did not reframe the cost as a long-term investment.
                                  ‚úÖ 7.4 The "Zip It" Agent allowed for a pause after the price reveal.

                                  üìà Improvements

                                  • üìà Reframe the cost as a long-term investment.
                                  • üìà Effectively anchor the daily cost against current spend.

                                  üë§ Customer 09:46 No, no, no. I'm just going, it's just making me go through the...
                                  üë§ Customer 10:04 Do I like a cardboard box? Or does your cat like a cardboard box?
                                  üë§ Customer 10:10 Oh, it's saying an error occurred. It's not letting me, I don't know why.
                                  üë§ Customer 10:46 It's already linked to my... Hold on, let me just do this.
                                  üë§ Customer 11:16 Is this tying me into any sort of subscription at the moment, or this is just like a trial?
                                  üë§ Customer 11:34 Okay. It added the payment message. Fantastic.
                                  üë§ Customer 11:42 Yeah, yeah, yeah.
                                  üë§ Customer 11:52 Amazing.
                                  üë§ Customer 12:10 Fantastic. But what's the discount I have now?
                                  üéß Agent 12:16 Yeah, at the moment, you've got 40% off for the first two boxes. Let me quickly explain everything that's gone ahead. So you've got a week's worth of fresh food on its way. It's arriving this Wednesday. It's at the price of ¬£7.77p. Your next box is scheduled to arrive a week later. So that'll be for a month's worth of food, and it's also discounted.
                                  üéß Agent 12:40 So that'll be ¬£31 for the month. We are a subscription-based service. There is no contract. There is no commitment. Like I said, it just means you can stop it at any time. And we always send you a reminder email before we take any payments out as well, just to double-check everything's good and yours. One extra thing for me as well, and I really want to stress this, it's kind of absolutely key, is use the transition guide. It'll come inside your first box. It'll show you exactly how to introduce our food in a way that works for your cat's system habits. It's kind of not just nice to have. It's what helps turn the fussier cats into foodies. We really recommend you kind of stick to that step-by-step, and then you'll really notice the benefits of our food moving forward.
                                  üéß Agent 13:24 Say again, sorry?
                                  üéß Agent 13:30 Yes, so that's basically it, yeah. There will be more to it as well. Like I mentioned, it'll give you like a booklet, and then you just read from the booklet, just follow the different tips and tricks from that.
                                  üéß Agent 13:48 Oh, does he? He's not a fossy eater at all, does he?
                                  üéß Agent 13:58 Yeah, yeah. Fantastic. I don't think that's going to be a problem, but I will follow the rules. I still recommend you kind of stick to it.
                                  üéß Agent 14:14 It's already sorted there for you. Everything's already set up.
                                  üéß Agent 14:20 If you have any questions, queries, if there's anything that you're not sure about, don't be afraid to call me back. Ask for Luke. They'll transfer you back over to me. I can then help get you sorted out from there.
                                  üéß Agent 14:32 For Luke. Luke.
                                  üéß Agent 14:34 Yeah. No problem.
                                  üéß Agent 14:38 No worries. No worries at all. I hope you enjoy the rest of your day as well.
                                  üéß Agent 14:44 You take care. Bye-bye.
                                  üéØ

                                  Clarity & The Close (Retention)

                                  4‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 8.0/10 ‚ñº

                                  The agent effectively closed the sale with clear instructions and ensured the customer understood the subscription model.

                                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                  ‚úÖ 8.1 Box 2 Transparency Your next box is scheduled to arrive a week later. So that'll be for a month's worth of food, and it's also discounted. Agent made a clear distinction between the taster and ongoing subscription.
                                  ‚úÖ 8.2 The "To-Do" List Use the transition guide. It'll come inside your first box. Agent provided clear instructions for the customer.
                                  ‚úÖ 8.3 Handling "No" (The Wrangle) Would you like to give us a go? Even if it was just the first box. I would. Agent effectively handled potential objections.
                                  ‚úÖ 8.4 Subscription Value We really recommend you kind of stick to that step-by-step, and then you'll really notice the benefits of our food moving forward. Agent emphasized the value of the subscription.

                                  üí™ Strengths

                                  • üí™ Clear instructions for the customer.
                                  • üí™ Effectively handled potential objections.

                                    Negative Markers (Red Flags)

                                    8‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 9.0/10 ‚ñº

                                    The agent avoided negative markers such as rushing or giving up, maintaining a positive and engaging interaction.

                                    ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                    ‚úÖ 9.1 Rushing Agent did not rush the customer.
                                    ‚úÖ 9.2 Giving Up Would you like to give us a go? Even if it was just the first box. I would. Agent did not give up and effectively closed the sale.
                                    ‚úÖ 9.3 Lack of Personalization Ichigo Agent used the pet's name during the price presentation.
                                    ‚úÖ 9.4 Price Too Early Price was not stated too early in the call.
                                    ‚úÖ 9.5 Transactional Pushing Agent did not push for the sale without identifying a need.
                                    ‚úÖ 9.6 Post-Payment Info Dumping Agent provided information before payment.
                                    ‚úÖ 9.7 The Logic Leap Agent did not ask for payment before connecting the fix to the discovery nugget.
                                    ‚úÖ 9.8 Rude/Abrasive Agent maintained a polite and friendly tone.

                                    üí™ Strengths

                                    • üí™ Maintained a positive and engaging interaction.
                                    • üí™ Avoided rushing or giving up on the customer.

                                      Human Element

                                      2‚úÖ 2‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                                      The agent demonstrated empathy and connected with the customer but could improve on linking specific solutions to identified needs.

                                      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                      ‚úÖ 10.1 The Empathy Bridge Oh, bless him. Fantastic. He's staring at me and meowing at me. Agent acknowledged the customer's comments about the pet.
                                      ‚ùå 10.2 "Earned the Price" Gate You'll notice like less smellier poos, like a shinier coat, better energy levels as well. Agent did not link specific solutions to identified needs before price reveal.
                                      ‚ùå 10.3 Solution Mirroring Agent did not address specific concerns like boredom or fussiness with tailored solutions.
                                      ‚úÖ 10.4 Information Sequencing Use the transition guide. It'll come inside your first box. Agent provided product education before payment.

                                      üí™ Strengths

                                      • üí™ Demonstrated empathy and connected with the customer.

                                      üìà Improvements

                                      • üìà Link specific solutions to identified needs before price reveal.
                                      • üìà Address specific concerns with tailored solutions.

                                      üìã Overall Assessment

                                      Melissa effectively engaged with the customer, using the pet's name frequently and maintaining a positive tone throughout the call. Then we tailor make it to Charlie then based on his age, weight, breed, activity levels, goals, and so much more.                                                 üìã Overall Assessment

                                                The agent successfully engaged the customer with a friendly and humorous tone, addressing the pet's needs and providing detailed information about the product. However, there were areas where the agent could improve in linking the product features to the specific needs of the pet and ensuring clarity in the pricing structure.

                                                üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                1. ‚úÖ Friendly and engaging tone
                                                2. ‚úÖ Thorough product knowledge
                                                3. ‚úÖ Effective use of humor and rapport

                                                üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                1. üî¥ Stronger connection between product features and pet's specific needs
                                                2. üî¥ Clearer explanation of ongoing subscription costs
                                                3. üî¥ More structured approach to addressing customer concerns

                                                  Product Precision (Mandatory Logic Gates)

                                                  2‚úÖ 1‚ùå Partial 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                  The agent mentioned the number of pouches but did not clearly explain the duration of the taster box.

                                                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes

                                                    üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                    3. üî¥ Avoid information dumping post-payment to maintain customer clarity.

                                                          ‚ùå 7.2 Value Comparison Did not anchor daily cost against current spend.
                                                          ‚ùå 7.3 Reframing (The Investment) Did not reframe cost as a long-term investment.
                                                          ‚úÖ 7.4 The "Zip It" Allowed for a pause after price reveal.

                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                          • üí™ Allowed pause after price reveal.

                                                          üìà Improvements

                                                          • üìà Clarify ongoing subscription costs.
                                                          • üìà Reframe cost as a long-term investment.

                                                          üéß Agent 02:40 No worries at all. So she's two years. What colour is she? Sorry, I'm a bit curious.

                                                          Clarity & The Close (Retention)

                                                          2‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                          The agent provided some clarity on the subscription but could improve on assigning homework and handling objections.

                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                          ‚ùå 8.1 Box 2 Transparency Your second box will then arrive two weeks after that at the same price I believe. Lacked clear distinction between taster and ongoing price.
                                                          ‚úÖ 8.2 The "To-Do" List What you need to do is clear up some freezer space. Assigned homework to clear freezer space.
                                                          ‚ùå 8.3 Handling "No" (The Wrangle) So did you say it's like a subscription so like will I have to cancel it like obviously if it doesn't. Did not provide a strong challenge to objections.
                                                          ‚úÖ 8.4 Subscription Value You'll start to notice the nutritional impacts of moving on to a fresh diet. Provided long-term reason to continue.

It's pretty much pause your subscription and hold on I'll guide you through it. So if you go into your button or box app and if you go to I believe it's account details and you can see at the bottom where it says a subscription. You can amend different things and you can add on the delivery note as well. You can do anything on there really and if you feel like you've noticed that maybe she's maybe getting a sensitive stomach to chicken then of course you can just pop that on and change your recipes and we'll tailor it to her needs. So it's pretty much just as simple as that. There's no hidden cost or anything like that when it comes to us. We're pretty much straight and direct.

                                                          üë§ Customer 19:57

                                                          Yeah okay perfect.

                                                          üéß Agent 20:04

                                                          Alright so is there any other questions at all or anything else I can help you with?

                                                          üë§ Customer 20:04

                                                          No that no.

                                                          üéß Agent 20:11

                                                          Perfect. Alright no worries at all. Well welcome to Button Up Box and we really do hope that Nelly loves the food. I'm pretty sure she will. Obviously if she wants to share it she can with yourself because it is human grade after all but yeah I'm pretty sure she'll scoff at all.

                                                          üë§ Customer 20:23

                                                          Alright perfect.

                                                          üéß Agent 20:30

                                                          No worries you take care. Have a lovely day.

                                                          üìã Overall Assessment

                                                          The agent effectively engaged the customer with a warm tone and personalized approach, addressing the pet's specific needs. However, there were minor lapses in product precision and price transformation clarity.

                                                          üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                          1. ‚úÖ Warm and engaging tone throughout the call.
                                                          2. ‚úÖ Effective use of the pet's name to build rapport.
                                                          3. ‚úÖ Addressed the pet's dietary concerns with relevant solutions.

                                                          üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                          1. üî¥ Ensure clarity in product precision, especially regarding taster details.

                                                          3. üî¥ Avoid information dumping post-payment; integrate value-building earlier.

                                                                üéß Agent 02:04 Yeah, that's kind of lovely size for her. But once you get into kind of a kind of proper food, it just makes sure that they're getting everything they need. They're getting all the nutrients they need. They're getting all the goodness.                                                                 üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                The agent demonstrated good energy and rapport but failed to fully adhere to the script guidelines, particularly in linking the product features to the pet's specific needs. There was a lack of clarity in the pricing structure and some missed opportunities for deeper discovery.

                                                                üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                1. ‚úÖ Good rapport and humor with the customer.
                                                                2. ‚úÖ Maintained positive tone and energy throughout the call.
                                                                3. ‚úÖ Acknowledged the pet's fussy eating habits.

                                                                üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                1. üî¥ Failed to clearly distinguish between the taster and ongoing subscription pricing.
                                                                2. üî¥ Did not fully explore the customer's previous experience with the brand.
                                                                3. üî¥ Missed opportunity to link product features to specific pet needs.

                                                                ‚úÖ 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) I've got a really fussy dog myself. Agent used humor and personal anecdotes to engage the customer.
                                                                ‚ùå 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule Now, what it is, it's basically just like a little trial period and it should be cheaper than what you currently spend... Agent had a monologue exceeding 45 seconds without a check-in.

                                                                    üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                    The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name, but failed to effectively connect the product benefits to the customer's needs. The call lacked depth in discovery and did not adequately address the customer's existing satisfaction with the product.

                                                                    üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                    1. ‚úÖ Positive tone and sentiment throughout the call.
                                                                    2. ‚úÖ Use of pet's name to create an emotional connection.
                                                                    3. ‚úÖ Clear offer of a discount to the customer.

                                                                    üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                    1. üî¥ Failed to explore the customer's needs or reasons for entering the survey.
                                                                    2. üî¥ Did not provide a detailed explanation of the product's benefits.
                                                                    3. üî¥ Missed opportunity to reframe the cost as an investment in the pet's health.

                                                                          Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

                                                                          1‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                          The agent mentioned a discount but did not provide a full breakdown of ongoing costs or reframe the price as an investment.

                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                          ‚ùå 7.1 The Journey Sequence [HARD FAIL] you'd be getting 40% off to what you usually pay for today and then your next order as well Did not cover ongoing subscription costs.
                                                                          ‚ùå 7.2 Value Comparison Did not anchor daily cost against current brand spend.
                                                                          ‚ùå 7.3 Reframing (The Investment) Did not reframe cost as a long-term investment.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 7.4 The 'Zip It' Allowed for customer response after price mention.

                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                          • üí™ Mentioned discount clearly.

                                                                          üìà Improvements

                                                                          • üìà Provide a full breakdown of ongoing costs.
                                                                          • üìà Reframe price as a long-term investment.
                                                                          üë§ Customer 01:50 Yeah, I do.
                                                                          üéß Agent 01:52 What I'm going to do then, the email we have is alinashepard1 at gmail.com. I'm going to change it to .uk just so I can add the discount for a new sort of...
                                                                          üë§ Customer 02:11 Oh, hello?
                                                                          üéØ

                                                                          Clarity & The Close (Retention)

                                                                          0‚úÖ 4‚ùå Fail 4.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                          The agent did not clearly distinguish between the taster and ongoing subscription prices or provide a 'To-Do' list.

                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                          ‚ùå 8.1 Box 2 Transparency Did not clearly distinguish between taster and ongoing prices.
                                                                          ‚ùå 8.2 The 'To-Do' List Did not assign any 'homework' to the customer.
                                                                          ‚ùå 8.3 Handling 'No' (The Wrangle) Did not provide a challenge or pushback to customer hesitation.
                                                                          ‚ùå 8.4 Subscription Value Did not give a long-term reason to continue subscription.

                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                            üìà Improvements

                                                                            • üìà Provide a 'To-Do' list to solidify commitment.
                                                                            üö©

                                                                            Negative Markers (Red Flags)

                                                                            ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                            ‚úÖ 9.1 Rushing Did not rush the customer.
                                                                            ‚ùå 9.2 Giving Up Accepted customer brush-off without challenge.
                                                                            ‚úÖ 9.3 Lack of Personalization Used pet's name during the call.
                                                                            ‚úÖ 9.4 Price Too Early Price was not stated too early.
                                                                            ‚úÖ 9.5 Transactional Pushing Did not push for sale without identifying a need.

                                                                            ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                            ‚ùå 10.1 The Empathy Bridge We order food from Maro basically once every month. Did not acknowledge customer's existing satisfaction with the product.

                                                                              • üìà Link product features to specific customer needs before price reveal.

                                                                                      ‚úÖ 9.1 Rushing Did not rush the customer.

                                                                                      ‚úÖ 9.4 Price Too Early Price was not stated too early.
                                                                                      ‚úÖ 9.5 Transactional Pushing Did not push for sale without identifying a need.
                                                                                      ‚úÖ 9.6 Post-Payment Info Dumping Provided information before payment.
                                                                                      ‚úÖ 9.7 The Logic Leap Connected Fix to Discovery before asking for payment.
                                                                                      ‚úÖ 9.8 Rude/Abrasive Maintained a respectful tone.

                                                                                      üí™ Strengths

                                                                                      • üí™ Avoided rushing and maintained engagement.
                                                                                      • üí™ Used pet's name during price presentation.

                                                                                      üìà Improvements

                                                                                        üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                        The agent demonstrated good energy and attempted to connect with the customer by addressing the pet's fussiness. However, the call lacked effective probing and failed to secure a sale due to insufficient handling of objections and a lack of personalized solutions.

                                                                                        üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                        1. ‚úÖ Maintained positive tone and energy throughout the call.
                                                                                        2. ‚úÖ Identified the pet's primary issue of fussiness.
                                                                                        3. ‚úÖ Attempted to build rapport by sharing personal experience.

                                                                                        üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                        1. üî¥ Failed to effectively handle objections and secure a sale.
                                                                                        2. üî¥ Did not provide a clear comparison of ongoing costs.
                                                                                        3. üî¥ Lacked detailed probing into the customer's current feeding routine.

                                                                                          Product Precision (Mandatory Logic Gates)

                                                                                          2‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 4.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                          The agent did not clearly explain the taster box details and failed to provide precise dietary percentages.

                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                          ‚ùå 6.1 The Taster Anatomy [HARD FAIL] for two weeks worth of food on a taster box it would come to around ¬£16 only. Did not state '14 pouches' and 'one pouch a day'.
                                                                                          ‚úÖ 6.2 The Taster Duration [HARD FAIL] No incorrect duration stated for 800g+ daily plan.
                                                                                          ‚ùå 6.3 Mixed Plan Compliance Did not provide exact dietary percentages.
                                                                                          ‚úÖ 6.4 Marro Specifics Not applicable as Marro specifics were not discussed.

                                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                                            üìà Improvements

                                                                                            • üìà Clearly explain the taster box details.
                                                                                            • üìà Provide precise dietary percentages.
                                                                                            üí∞

                                                                                            Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

                                                                                            1‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                            The agent mentioned the taster price but did not provide ongoing cost transparency or effectively reframe the investment.

                                                                                            ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.1 The Journey Sequence [HARD FAIL] for two weeks worth of food on a taster box it would come to around ¬£16 only. Did not state ongoing subscription cost for Box 2+.
                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.2 Value Comparison Did not anchor daily cost against current brand spend.
                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.3 Reframing (The Investment) Did not effectively reframe the cost as a long-term investment.
                                                                                            ‚úÖ 7.4 The 'Zip It' Allowed for a pause after price reveal.

                                                                                            üí™ Strengths

                                                                                              üìà Improvements

                                                                                              • üìà Provide ongoing cost transparency.
                                                                                              • üìà Reframe the cost as a long-term investment.
                                                                                              üéØ

                                                                                              Clarity & The Close (Retention)

                                                                                              0‚úÖ 4‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                              The agent did not clearly distinguish between taster and ongoing prices and failed to handle objections effectively.

                                                                                              ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                              ‚ùå 8.1 Box 2 Transparency Did not make a clear distinction between taster and ongoing prices.
                                                                                              ‚ùå 8.2 The 'To-Do' List Did not assign any 'homework' to the customer.
                                                                                              ‚ùå 8.3 Handling 'No' (The Wrangle) Yeah, well I can just get you an estimate and then if you're happy then I can give you a call back and we can sign up another time. I think I'll leave it for now because I'm waiting for a phone call. Did not effectively challenge the brush-off.
                                                                                              ‚ùå 8.4 Subscription Value Did not give a long-term reason to continue.

                                                                                              üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                üìà Improvements

                                                                                                • üìà Clearly distinguish between taster and ongoing prices.
                                                                                                • üìà Handle objections more effectively.
                                                                                                üö©

                                                                                                Negative Markers (Red Flags)

                                                                                                ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                ‚úÖ 9.1 Rushing Agent did not rush the customer.
                                                                                                ‚ùå 9.2 Giving Up Yeah, well I can just get you an estimate and then if you're happy then I can give you a call back and we can sign up another time. I think I'll leave it for now because I'm waiting for a phone call. Agent accepted brush-off without effective challenge.
                                                                                                ‚úÖ 9.3 Lack of Personalization Jess Used pet's name during price presentation.
                                                                                                ‚úÖ 9.4 Price Too Early Price not stated within first 2 minutes.
                                                                                                ‚úÖ 9.5 Transactional Pushing Identified a need before pitching.
                                                                                                ‚úÖ 9.6 Post-Payment Info Dumping No significant info dumping after payment.
                                                                                                ‚úÖ 9.7 The Logic Leap Did not ask for payment before connecting fix to discovery nugget.
                                                                                                ‚úÖ 9.8 Rude/Abrasive No rude or abrasive tone detected.

                                                                                                The agent demonstrated good energy and empathy, particularly when discussing Pip's health issues.                                                                                                 üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                1. ‚úÖ Empathy towards Pip's health issues.
                                                                                                2. ‚úÖ Maintained positive tone and energy.
                                                                                                3. ‚úÖ Engaged in active discovery about Pip's diet and preferences.

                                                                                                üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                3. üî¥ Avoid information dumping after payment confirmation.

                                                                                                  Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

                                                                                                  2‚úÖ 1‚ùå Partial 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                  The agent engaged in active discovery but missed deeper probing into the customer's current brand knowledge.

                                                                                                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                  ‚ùå 3.1 Brand Knowledge Check Agent did not gauge what the customer already knows about the brand.
                                                                                                  ‚úÖ 3.2 The "Discovery Loop" (Logic Gate) What are you currently feeding Pip at the moment? She's on Cook House Luxury Dog Food. Agent asked about current feeding but did not probe further.
                                                                                                  ‚úÖ 3.3 Nugget Extraction Oh, is she a fussy eater? Yeah, she just, when she wants to really. Identified fussy eating as a specific concern.

                                                                                                  üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                  • üìà Probe deeper into customer's current brand knowledge.

                                                                                                  üë§ Customer 00:42 She's on Cook House Luxury Dog Food. It's a turin. So that's all she has. Very particular, unfortunately.

                                                                                                  üéß Agent 00:59 Oh, okay. Well, you're certainly not alone. We have, you know, so many people with fussy eaters moving over to Button Up Box and that's because our food is just really fresh and we do have a large variety of recipes as well.
                                                                                                  üéß Agent 01:18 Very good, yeah. Yeah, so it just keeps interesting. I mean, we're not dry, we're not canned and we're not raw. And we provide, you know, fresh, high quality, human grade, natural meals made of real food. So there's no additives or fillers or anything like that. And each meal is packed with freshly cooked meat mixed with nutritious fruit and veg. And as you may have heard, a fresh, whole food diet is the best form of nutrition for both humans and dogs. And we just make it really easy and convenient for you because there's absolutely no prep whatsoever and it's ready to serve.
                                                                                                  üéß Agent 01:53 From what you said, I think Button Up Box could be a really great fit for yourself and Pip.                                                                                                       üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                      The agent demonstrated good energy and rapport-building skills, but missed opportunities for deeper discovery and failed to clearly articulate product specifics and pricing. The call ended with a callback arrangement due to the customer's financial constraints.

                                                                                                      üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                      1. ‚úÖ Maintained positive tone and energy throughout the call.
                                                                                                      2. ‚úÖ Used humor and rapport-building effectively.
                                                                                                      3. ‚úÖ Identified the pet's fussiness as a key concern.

                                                                                                      üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                      1. üî¥ Provide clearer product details and pricing structure.
                                                                                                      2. üî¥ Ensure all customer concerns are addressed before discussing payment.
                                                                                                      3. üî¥ Use the pet's name more frequently to build emotional connection.

                                                                                                      Detailed Section Breakdown

                                                                                                      üåê

                                                                                                      Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                                                                                                      2‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                      The agent maintained a positive tone and energy but did not use the pet's name frequently enough and had a monologue over 45 seconds.

                                                                                                      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                      ‚ùå 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) Banjo Pet name used only twice, not in all key sections.
                                                                                                      ‚úÖ 1.2 Tone & Sentiment (The 'Smile' Test) Hello, yeah we got some good news for you. Agent maintained a positive and enthusiastic tone.
                                                                                                      ‚úÖ 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) If you did like us, we'll have a massive party. Agent used humor and maintained energy to engage the customer.
                                                                                                      ‚ùå 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule So what you'll be sort of looking at for a taster box is about 22 pounds... Agent had a monologue over 45 seconds without a check-in.

                                                                                                      üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                      • üí™ Positive tone and energy.
                                                                                                      • üí™ Effective use of humor.

                                                                                                      üìà Improvements

                                                                                                      • üìà Use pet's name more frequently.
                                                                                                      • üìà Avoid long monologues without customer engagement.
                                                                                                      üéß Agent 00:00 Hello, is that Mary speaking? Hello Mary, it's Costa calling from Button Up Box regarding the survey you entered for Banjo.
                                                                                                      üë§ Customer 00:09 Yes, speaking. Oh yeah, hi there.
                                                                                                      üéß Agent 00:11 Hello, yeah we got some good news for you. Banjo's qualified for the promotion that we got running here at Button Up Box. So we get to try fresh personalised dog food, which is really good. It's sort of like a trial period just to see how Banjo gets on. Do you know much about what we do here at Button Up Box?
                                                                                                      üë§ Customer 00:38 I don't really know to be honest, but he normally eats fresh food, you know, like I give him steak, I give him chicken, I give him all the meat. Yeah, he doesn't eat any of the tin stuff or dried food, hardly.
                                                                                                      üéß Agent 00:52 Okay, that's good. So I'm guessing that this food is all freshly as it advertises. So it might be an idea to try him, he might get on with it. Yeah, fresh food as you mentioned already, it's sort of like home cooking for dogs. That's the sort of best way to sort of describe it. We only do high quality human grade natural oils made with real food. There's no prep required in your end as well. So it's like you're all ready to serve, which makes it really convenient.
                                                                                                      üë§ Customer 01:02 Yeah. I mean, to be honest with you, if he gets on with it, which is brilliant, it'll save me a lot of time and hassle. But see, sometimes with that food that I give him, he won't touch it. He'll leave it for two, three days and then he'll eat it. Obviously, if it's something like fish, I can't leave it down because it will go off, even chicken. So he's just weird. He either eats or he doesn't, you know, he's just one of these dogs that, and for a Labrador, it's not like a Labrador not to eat. He can turn up his nose at anything.
                                                                                                      üéß Agent 02:03 Right. Let's just hope he gets on well with this. Yeah. The good thing about us at Butternut Box as well is we sort of specialise with fossy dogs anyway. So we sort of tailor our boxes towards fossy dogs. We have around 12 different recipes within the box as well. And the one that Banjo is qualified for today, you've got beef in there, turkey, lamb, etc. And it's sort of a thing where you could sort of tailor the boxes and switch the boxes round as well. So if Banjo was to get fossy towards a specific meal prep, you could always switch it around as well, which is really good. Then we sort of see what Banjo takes to and then you can sort of tailor his boxes going forward, which is really good. So what I can do for you today, again, is give you 30% off your first couple of boxes. Do you know how much Banjo weighs? I could sort of give you a quote on how much you'd be looking at for him.
                                                                                                      üë§ Customer 03:15 Well, I don't know really, but he's definitely over 30K. 30K, so he's a big boy. Yeah, yeah. Is it not free then today?

                                                                                                      Introduction (The Trifecta)

                                                                                                      2‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                      The agent introduced themselves and the brand effectively, using positive framing and avoiding apologies.

                                                                                                      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                      ‚úÖ 2.1 Identity & Brand Anchor Hello Mary, it's Costa calling from Button Up Box regarding the survey you entered for Banjo. Agent stated their name and brand within the first 10 seconds.
                                                                                                      ‚úÖ 2.2 Structure & Authority Hello, yeah we got some good news for you. Agent used positive framing and avoided apologies.

                                                                                                      • üí™ Positive framing of the offer.

                                                                                                      üìà Improvements

                                                                                                      Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

                                                                                                      2‚úÖ 1‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                      The agent identified the pet's fussiness but did not fully explore the customer's existing knowledge or dietary preferences.

                                                                                                      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes

                                                                                                      • üìà Explore customer's existing knowledge more thoroughly.

                                                                                                          üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                          The agent demonstrated a good understanding of the product and attempted to connect with the customer. However, the call lacked personalization and failed to effectively address the customer's specific concerns, leading to a missed sale opportunity.

                                                                                                          üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                          1. ‚úÖ Attempted to connect product benefits to customer's needs.
                                                                                                          2. ‚úÖ Maintained a positive and engaging tone.
                                                                                                          3. ‚úÖ Provided detailed information about the product's nutritional benefits.

                                                                                                          üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                          2. üî¥ Address specific customer concerns more directly before pitching.
                                                                                                          3. üî¥ Ensure clear distinction between trial and ongoing costs.

                                                                                                                The agent demonstrated a good understanding of the customer's needs and attempted to guide them through the payment process. However, the call lacked effective energy leadership and failed to secure the sale due to customer hesitance and technical difficulties.

                                                                                                                üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                2. ‚úÖ Identified specific dietary preferences and issues.
                                                                                                                3. ‚úÖ Attempted to guide the customer through the online payment process.

                                                                                                                3. üî¥ Address customer hesitations more effectively to prevent sale loss.
