                                                                                                                            üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                            The agent demonstrated strong brand knowledge and maintained a positive tone throughout the call. However, there were missed opportunities in connecting specific pet needs to product features, and the call could have benefited from more personalized engagement.

                                                                                                                            üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                            1. ‚úÖ Positive and engaging tone throughout the call.
                                                                                                                            2. ‚úÖ Clear explanation of product benefits and features.
                                                                                                                            3. ‚úÖ Effective handling of callback arrangement.

                                                                                                                            üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                            1. üî¥ Increase use of the pet's name to strengthen emotional connection.
                                                                                                                            2. üî¥ Better linkage of product features to specific pet needs.
                                                                                                                            3. üî¥ Provide more detailed information on ongoing subscription costs.

                                                                                                                            Detailed Section Breakdown

                                                                                                                            üåê

                                                                                                                            Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                                                                                                                            3‚úÖ 1‚ùå Partial 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                            The agent maintained a positive tone and energy throughout the call but did not use the pet's name frequently enough.

                                                                                                                            ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                            ‚ùå 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) Blue Pet name used only twice, not meeting the target of 3 times.
                                                                                                                            ‚úÖ 1.2 Tone & Sentiment (The 'Smile' Test) Okay, brilliant, great stuff. Agent maintained a positive and engaging tone.
                                                                                                                            ‚úÖ 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) Yep, you're the lucky one. Agent used humor and maintained high energy.
                                                                                                                            ‚úÖ 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule No monologue exceeded 45 seconds without a check-in.

                                                                                                                            üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                            • üí™ Positive and engaging tone.
                                                                                                                            • üí™ Maintained high energy and humor.

                                                                                                                            üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                            • üìà Increase frequency of pet name usage.
                                                                                                                            üéß Agent 00:00 Hello? Hi, is that Sarah speaking?                                                                                                                               ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                              ‚úÖ 6.1 The Taster Anatomy [HARD FAIL] And that will consist of 14 400-gram pouches, so he'd need two of them a day. Agent correctly stated the taster box details.
                                                                                                                              ‚úÖ 6.2 The Taster Duration [HARD FAIL] You'll find this will stretch a bit further than that as well. Agent implied correct duration for the taster box.

                                                                                                                              üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                              • üí™ Accurate taster box details.

                                                                                                                              üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                              • üìà Provide exact dietary percentage for mixed plans.
                                                                                                                              üë§ Customer 02:24 No.
                                                                                                                              üéß Agent 02:26 Good, good. That's what we like to hear. Okey-doke. So, Sarah, a little bit more about what we do. We provide, we've got 11 different recipes, and they're made up, as I say, freshly cooked meat. Now, these are human quality cuts of meat, which is obviously great for, in terms of protein, it's great for building muscle, particularly important in large breed dogs when they're puppies, obviously growing up into adulthood. And they're a lot easier to digest than, of course, dry food, but also raw food as well, because raw food, just as if we were to eat it, has to be broken down in the stomach, the fats need to be broken down, and it needs to be absorbed through the gut. So, being cooked, of course, it takes care of that. Now, the natural vegetables and healthy carbs make up the other 40%, providing fibre, vitamins and antioxidants, and, of course, slow-release energy that's going to keep them feeling fuller for longer. Particularly important, again, with high energy dogs, so that the dog's thinking, I want some more food. It also helps, in its own right, help solve sensitive stomachs, being high in fibre, and also inconsistent poos. So, you should start to see smaller, firmer ones, which will be great news for Blue, great news for whoever has to clean it up as well.
                                                                                                                              üí∞

Yeah, that's it, I'd sooner pick it up than step in it, so it's one of them. Now, things that are going to benefit Blue as well, we don't add any nasties into any of our recipes, nothing whatsoever. They're all hypoallergenic, there's no meat by-products, you know, cuts of meat that aren't fit for human consumption, like you get with raw food. Colours, flavourings, preservatives, no bulk fillers, so it's good because you know exactly what Blue's eating, okay? If we can't pronounce it, we don't put it in, simple as that.

                                                                                                                                ‚ñº Show
                                                                                                                                üéß Agent 00:00

So, Sarah, a little bit more about what we do. We provide, we've got 11 different recipes, and they're made up, as I say, freshly cooked meat. Now, these are human quality cuts of meat, which is obviously great for, in terms of protein, it's great for building muscle, particularly important in large breed dogs when they're puppies, obviously growing up into adulthood. And they're a lot easier to digest than, of course, dry food, but also raw food as well, because raw food, just as if we were to eat it, has to be broken down in the stomach, the fats need to be broken down, and it needs to be absorbed through the gut. So, being cooked, of course, it takes care of that. Now, the natural vegetables and healthy carbs make up the other 40%, providing fibre, vitamins and antioxidants, and, of course, slow-release energy that's going to keep them feeling fuller for longer. Particularly important, again, with high energy dogs, so that the dog's thinking, I want some more food. It also helps, in its own right, help solve sensitive stomachs, being high in fibre, and also inconsistent poos. So, you should start to see smaller, firmer ones, which will be great news for Blue, great news for whoever has to clean it up as well.

                                                                                                                                The agent demonstrated a basic understanding of the product and attempted to engage the customer. However, the call lacked personalization and failed to effectively connect the product features to the customer's specific needs.

                                                                                                                                üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                üí¨ Full Transcript (1 lines)

                                                                                                                                ‚ñº Show
                                                                                                                                üéß Agent 00:00

                                                                                                                                Hi there, is that Ian? Speaking. Hi Ian, it's Kyle calling from Button Up Box, the dog food company. Which food, where? Button Up Box? Button Up Box, yeah, the dog food company. Oh yeah, yeah. Yeah, just a quick call Ian, it's regarding the social media survey you entered for Bailey. Yeah. Yeah, it's good news Ian, you have secured yourself a massive discount with me today, so you can try our personalised dog food. It's like a little trial box really for Bailey, but do you remember entering firstly? I think so, yeah. Yeah, no problem. Do you know anything about what we do here at Button Up Box? We produce high quality dog food. Yeah, it's pretty simple Ian. So it's not canned food, it's not dry food and it's not raw food, it's simply fresh, high quality human grade meals. So, 11 different recipes and you're looking at 60% freshly cooked meat, the other 40% is fruit and veg. Pretty simple really. Tell me a little bit about Bailey, so what's he eating at the moment? It's biscuits, dog biscuits, he likes chicken as well. Yeah. He always says he loves that, I see on the telly how dogs prefer human grade food. Most dogs eat like sick off the floor, I've done that before. I mean, what breed is he? Border Collie. Okay, yeah, well that would explain, yeah, probably the majority of it then. It depends on breed really, little dogs normally can be more fussy, but it's because a lot of the time they're more pampered really. Okay, no worries, good stuff. Is he a good eater then, yeah? Yeah, yeah, he's a good eater. Perfect, so he's just on kibble and then like some of your own home cooking, yeah? Pardon? He's just on kibble, so dry food and then some of your own home cooking. Yeah, just some chicken and stuff, yeah, biscuits, yeah, the good quality dog biscuits, I can't remember what they're called. Okay, good stuff though, Rose, that's absolutely fine, he's a good eater, so that's all good. Again, so just a little bit more about us at Butternut Box for Liam. So essentially it's all human cooking, but it's easy and convenient for you because there's no prep, but no artificial flavours, preservatives or any fillers either. So pretty simple really, all made with real food. But what made you fill it out, Ian? I can't remember now. It's not a bad start on the food. I thought I'd try them on it. Yeah, yeah, no worries, absolutely fine. Essentially what you secured with me today, Ian, is 30% off a trial box. You've got 30% off a month's worth after if you want it, but for your first two orders. We start off with two weeks normally, see how they go along, and you get 24-hour access to our veterinary nursing team. So it's a bit like one-on-one for dogs really. So that's quite handy. To give you a rough idea of pricing, Ian, on a trial box, do you know how much Bailey weighs at the moment? No. Don't know, okay, no problem. Would you say that he is average weight? Yes. Yeah, and how old is he? Five. He's five, okay, no problem. So you're probably looking in that case anywhere between 14 and 20 kg normally? Yeah. If he's about average weight, so say 15 kilos.                                                                                                                                     üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                                    The agent maintained a positive tone and attempted to engage the customer, but the call lacked depth in discovery and failed to establish a strong connection between the product and the customer's needs. The call ended with a callback arrangement without a clear commitment.

                                                                                                                                    üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                    1. ‚úÖ Positive tone and energy throughout the call.
                                                                                                                                    2. ‚úÖ Attempted to engage the customer with questions about the pet.
                                                                                                                                    3. ‚úÖ Arranged a callback to follow up on the conversation.

                                                                                                                                    üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                    1. üî¥ Failed to use the pet's name frequently enough to create an emotional connection.
                                                                                                                                    2. üî¥ Did not establish a clear link between the product features and the pet's specific needs.
                                                                                                                                    3. üî¥ Missed opportunity to provide detailed product information before discussing payment.

                                                                                                                                    Detailed Section Breakdown

                                                                                                                                    üåê

                                                                                                                                    Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                                                                                                                                    2‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                    The agent maintained a positive tone but did not use the pet's name frequently enough and had a monologue over 45 seconds.

                                                                                                                                    ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                    ‚ùå 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) Rocco Pet name used only twice, not in all required sections.
                                                                                                                                    ‚úÖ 1.2 Tone & Sentiment (The 'Smile' Test) Hi Sam, it's Matthew here at Button Up Box. Agent maintained a positive and warm tone.
                                                                                                                                    ‚úÖ 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) Oh, cute. And how old is he? Agent attempted to lift the energy with positive remarks.
                                                                                                                                    ‚ùå 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule So we give the full calorie intake into one packet for you... Agent had a monologue over 45 seconds without a check-in.

                                                                                                                                    üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                    • üí™ Attempted to engage with questions.

                                                                                                                                          Negative Markers (Red Flags)

                                                                                                                                          5‚úÖ 3‚ùå Pass 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                          The agent avoided major negative markers but could improve on personalization and information sequencing.

                                                                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 9.1 Rushing Did not rush the customer.
                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 9.2 Giving Up I'll give you a call back then on Friday. Did not give up on the call.
                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 9.3 Lack of Personalization Did not use pet's name during price presentation.
                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 9.4 Price Too Early Price was not stated too early.
                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 9.5 Transactional Pushing Did not push for sale without identifying a need.
                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 9.6 Post-Payment Info Dumping Some information was provided after discussing payment.
                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 9.7 The Logic Leap Asked for payment without connecting fix to discovery nugget.
                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 9.8 Rude/Abrasive No rude or abrasive tone detected.

                                                                                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                          • üí™ Avoided rushing and giving up.

                                                                                                                                          üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                          • üìà Use pet's name during price presentation.
                                                                                                                                          • üìà Improve information sequencing.
                                                                                                                                          üéß Agent 05:59 Perfect. I'll call you then. You can obviously give her all the details in terms of that. And what we can make sure we do, is get the delivery a day before you get Rocco, so that you've got the food waiting there. Yeah?
                                                                                                                                          üë§ Customer 06:10 All right, thank you.
                                                                                                                                          üéß Agent 06:11 Okay, perfect. Not to worry. Well, enjoy the rest of your evening, Sam. Whatever you're up to. Thanks a lot.
                                                                                                                                          üë§ Customer 06:17 Thank you. Bye.
                                                                                                                                          üß†

                                                                                                                                          1‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 4.0/10 ‚ñº

You get better coat conditions. You get less moistened and you should see him gradually starting to lose a little bit of weight as well. We are a subscription-based service but there is no lock-in contract. Even if you are just looking for a little bit of advice, you can give us a call. We're not just a dog food, we are a service. That's everything done for me.                                                                                                                                           üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                                          The agent effectively engaged the customer with a warm tone and personalized approach, addressing the pet's dietary concerns. However, there were missed opportunities in linking specific product features to the pet's needs and some procedural details were discussed post-payment.

                                                                                                                                          üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                          1. ‚úÖ Warm and engaging tone throughout the call.
                                                                                                                                          2. ‚úÖ Effective use of pet's name to build rapport.
                                                                                                                                          3. ‚úÖ Addressed customer's concerns about pet's diet and digestion.

                                                                                                                                          üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                          1. üî¥ Ensure product features are explicitly linked to the pet's specific needs.
                                                                                                                                          2. üî¥ Avoid discussing procedural details after payment.
                                                                                                                                          3. üî¥ Provide a clearer breakdown of the ongoing subscription costs.

                                                                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) Bella Bella Pet name used multiple times across different sections.

                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.3 Energy Leadership (The "Lift" Test) I love them. Yeah, I've got a man across the river from me and he's got two and they are just beautiful. They are. They also are very energetic, even at nine years old. Agent effectively lifted the energy with humor and empathy.
                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.4 The 45-Second "Robot" Rule Our food is entirely human grade, cooks slow and slow in our kitchens... Is that all she's on at the moment, just dry food? Agent avoided long monologues without customer engagement.

                                                                                                                                                The agent matched the pet's dietary concerns with appropriate product features but missed some opportunities for deeper connections.

                                                                                                                                                ‚úÖ 4.1 Breed-Specific Proactivity What kind of dog is she? She's a Hungarian Vizsla, short haired. Agent inquired about the breed and discussed relevant dietary benefits.
                                                                                                                                                ‚úÖ 4.2 Need-Solution Match So therefore all the goodness is kept in the pouches. Meat, fish, entirely human grade. I think it was more for the fact that, like, I don't know, I feel like she gets bored with the food that she eats. Agent addressed the pet's dietary concerns with product features.

                                                                                                                                                üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                                • üìà Missed opportunities for deeper connections between product features and specific pet needs.

                                                                                                                                                The Pitch (Visuals & Value)

                                                                                                                                                ‚ùå 1.4 The 45-Second "Robot" Rule Yeah. I mean, I know, I mean, if it's the kidneys, I mean, and renal, I mean, I know for renal failure, they usually add lentils, but obviously, I've just read that it has to be high protein and phosphorus for dogs with kidney failure, typically require a diet low in protein and phosphorus to reduce the workload on the kidneys. And butternut box meals contain an average of 11 to 14% protein, 40 to 48 on a dry matter basis, which is too high for specific requirements of the kidney. So it wouldn't be ideal for your dog.

                                                                                                                                                Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

                                                                                                                                                1‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                The agent attempted to understand the customer's situation but did not effectively probe deeper into the customer's knowledge or needs.

                                                                                                                                                ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes

                                                                                                                                                      üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                                                      The agent failed to establish a strong connection with the customer and did not effectively address the customer's needs. The call lacked personalization and failed to convert the interest into a sale.

                                                                                                                                                      üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                                      1. ‚úÖ Attempted to build rapport by mentioning a personal connection with bulldogs.
                                                                                                                                                      2. ‚úÖ Used the pet's name during the conversation.
                                                                                                                                                      3. ‚úÖ Mentioned the high-quality, human-grade meals offered by Butternut Box.

                                                                                                                                                      üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                                      1. üî¥ Failed to effectively handle the customer's initial resistance.
                                                                                                                                                      2. üî¥ Did not provide a compelling reason for the customer to switch from their current brand.
                                                                                                                                                      3. üî¥ Lacked a structured approach to address the customer's financial concerns.

                                                                                                                                                      Detailed Section Breakdown

                                                                                                                                                      üåê

                                                                                                                                                      Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                                                                                                                                                      2‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 4.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                      The agent used the pet's name but failed to maintain high energy and enthusiasm throughout the call.

                                                                                                                                                      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                      ‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency (The Emotional Hook) So Rocco likes his food. Pet name used but not consistently across all sections.
                                                                                                                                                      ‚ùå 1.2 Tone & Sentiment (The 'Smile' Test) Okay, thank you. Tone was neutral and lacked enthusiasm.
                                                                                                                                                      ‚ùå 1.3 Energy Leadership (The 'Lift' Test) Okay, cool. Agent did not lift the energy of the call.
                                                                                                                                                      ‚úÖ 1.4 The 45-Second 'Robot' Rule No monologue exceeded 45 seconds.

                                                                                                                                                      üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                                      • üí™ Used pet's name during the call.

                                                                                                                                                      üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                                      • üìà Maintain a more positive and engaging tone.

                                                                                                                                                      0‚úÖ 2‚ùå Fail 3.0/10 ‚ñº
